meanings.definition: Blarneys (noun): flattering or wheedling talk; cajolery.
meanings.sent1: Her blarneys convinced everyone to help her with the project.
meanings.sent2: The salesman's blarneys were so smooth that he sold out of products quickly.
meanings.sent3: The politician's blarneys were so sweet that even the skeptics believed him.
meanings.sent4: Her blarneys were like a magic spell, enchanting all who listened.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's blarneys made learning seem like a fun adventure.

meanings.definition: Blarneys (verb): to influence or persuade by flattery or smooth talk.
meanings.sent1: He blarneys his way into getting what he wants.
meanings.sent2: She blarneys her boss to get a promotion.
meanings.sent3: The cat blarneys its owner into giving extra treats.
meanings.sent4: The wind blarneys the leaves off the trees in a gentle dance.
meanings.sent5: The sun blarneys the flowers to bloom brightly in the garden.
